testcase.name: This scenario is to verify that $x:result consists of two text nodes Result should be text nodes
This scenario is to verify that $x:result consists of two text nodes Result count should be 2

xslt-version=1.0 in this XSpec file should always make all of the tests in this scenario Success, even when this XSpec file is imported to another XSpec file which has xslt-version=2.0 or higher. Comparing the text nodes with string

xslt-version=1.0 in this XSpec file should always make all of the tests in this scenario Success, even when this XSpec file is imported to another XSpec file which has xslt-version=2.0 or higher. Comparing the text nodes with double

xslt-version=1.0 in this XSpec file should always make all of the tests in this scenario Success, even when this XSpec file is imported to another XSpec file which has xslt-version=2.0 or higher. Comparing the text nodes with decimal

xslt-version=1.0 in this XSpec file should always make all of the tests in this scenario Success, even when this XSpec file is imported to another XSpec file which has xslt-version=2.0 or higher. Comparing the text nodes with integer

xslt-version=1.0 in this XSpec file should make this scenario Success when this XSpec file is executed independently. On the other hand, the result should be Failure when this XSpec file is imported to another XSpec file which has xslt-version=2.0 or higher. Expecting the compiled stylesheet to have version=1.0
